content.description: Above the clean low-angle slab, aim for a hanging block to the right of a wide crack. Climb over the middle of the block, through the X made by seams, continue straight up above the block on more X seams to a left-leaning ridge. Follow the ridge a few feet to a nice flat ledge just above the tyrolean rappel bolts and belay with gear on the ledge or step down to the bolts. Descent: rappel from the bolts.
content.location: Just to the right of the wide crack of Stephanie's Stomping Grounds, low on the right side of the Chuckwalla Wall.

content.description: Climb a water streak wrinkled with cracks past two overlaps. Continue on easier ledgy ground to a catclaw tree. Belay on the Tyrolean rappel bolts. To descend, rappel from these bolts (which will likely need new slings) or scramble up the gully to a ledge just below the lower anchors of the Tyrolean, left on the ledge to the Chuckwalla Couloir.
content.location: On the Chuckwalla Wall a short ways out of the wash at the back of a low-angle slab.

content.description: At the back of a clean low-angle facet of rock is a wide crack left of a hanging block. Climb the crack with many small ledges and face holds until it ends at the base of a gully/ramp system with a catclaw bush. Belay at two bolts from the Tyrolean rappel behind the bush. Descend by rappelling from here.
content.location: Near the right end of the Chuckwalla Wall about 50' out of the wash.

climbs.name: Sand Baggins
climbs.fa: Dan Briley, Bart Dinsman, Jim "Frodo" Lybarger

content.description: Walk up the low-angle base to a short vertical section with a bolt. Climb straight up past the bolt on thin flakes and seams staying to the right of the small overhangs in the dark brown rock. Tiny wires and micro cams are the only pro after the bolt. Belay on a good ledge with gear. Descend by traversing right to the gully/ramp then 1) follow the ramp down to rappel bolts behind a catclaw bush, or 2) go up the ramp about 80' and traverse left to the Chuckwalla Couloir on the ledge system just below the tyrolean bolts, scramble back down the couloir.
content.protection: One bolt, tiny wires and micro cams.
content.location: A short ways out of the wash is a clean, low-angle facet of rock that comes out of the talus at the base of Chuckwalla Wall. The route starts at the top left side of this feature.

content.description: Easy slab moves bring you to a bulge with a bolt. Pull the bulge and continue up and slightly left to another bolt. Belay o the ledge above. Descent: A few feet of scrambling above the ledge is a steep gully. The Tyrollean rappel is at the bottom of this gully behind a catclaw tree. Or scramble up the gully, when it ends at the Tyrollean bolts go left across the face on a ledge system to the top of Chuckwalla Coulior and take this back to the base.
content.protection: Two bolts. tiny to small gear.
content.location: Center of the Chuckwalla Wall halfway up the couloir.

content.description: Climb up slabs, passing a couple of incipient seams to a better seam and follow it left to a ledge. Descend the ledge left with an easy but bouldery exit.
content.location: On the left end of the Chuckwalla Wall, three quarters of the way up the couloir, at the cleanest section of slab.

content.description: Same start as Mystery Route. Climb up 15' past a tiny fixed wire, to a small ramp that goes up and left. Pull a small bulge, crux, continue left a few more feet to reach small discontinuous cracks that go straight up right, belay on a large ledge. Descent: From the ledge, step right to join shallow steep gully under the Tyrollean anchors. Go down the gully to the Tyrollean rappel or up to the ledges left of the Tyrollean anchors. Take the ledges left to finish down the Chuckwalla Couloir.
content.protection: Brass nuts, cams- micro up to 2".

climbs.name: Cadence Corner
climbs.fa: Dustin Wilkinson, Lance Ditzler, Dan Briley

content.description: From the wash climb a tiny dihedral to an easy slab, going up and right. Mount the free standing rock on either left or right and follow the left leaning ridge up to a nice flat belay ledge above the tyrolean rappel bolts. Belay with gear here or step down to the bolts. Rappel from the bolts to descend.
content.location: This route follows the broken ridge between the Chuckwalla Wall and the First Waterfall area. It starts on the left side of the alcove.

content.description: Just before the First Waterfall are two couloirs, the one left of the wash is the Chuckwalla Couloir (the one on the right is the Death Couloir). Chuckwalla Wall forms the right side of the couloir from the wash until it ends. This place is named for the large lizards that live all over the slabs.
